headline: Boilermaker Tailgate Chili
description: This boilermaker chili simmers up ground beef, sausage, beans, and tons of spice for a real crowd-pleaser. It's a favorite for game day or any day.

video.description: This chili satisfies any time of year. Make it the night before and it‚Äôs ready for any occasion.
video.name: Boilermaker Tailgate Chili

name: Boilermaker Tailgate Chili
recipeIngredient: 1 (15 ounce) can chili beans in spicy sauce
2 (28 ounce) cans diced tomatoes with juice
1 green bell pepper, seeded and chopped
1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped
2 green chile peppers, seeded and chopped
0.25 cup chili powder, or more to taste
2 teaspoons hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco¬Æ)
1 teaspoon salt, or more to taste
1 teaspoon ground black pepper, or more to taste
1 (10.5 ounce) bag corn chips (such as Fritos¬Æ)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large stock pot over medium-high heat. Crumble ground chuck and sausage into the hot pan. Cook, stirring frequently, until meat is evenly browned. Drain off excess grease.

Pour in chili beans, spicy chili beans, diced tomatoes, and tomato paste. Add celery, onion, bell peppers, chile peppers, bacon bits, bouillon, beer, 1/4 cup chili powder, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, oregano, cumin, hot pepper sauce, basil, cayenne, paprika, sugar, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1 teaspoon black pepper. Stir to blend, then cover and simmer over low heat for at least 2 hours, stirring occasionally.

Taste and season with more salt, pepper, and chili powder if necessary. The longer the chili simmers, the better it will taste. Remove from the heat and serve, or cool, refrigerate, and reheat the next day.
To serve, ladle hot chili into bowls and top with corn chips and Cheddar cheese.

review.reviewBody: I do tweek it to my liking but not by much all n all awesome recipe.

Love it! Tone down the ingredients with "heat" as my family does not like chili that is real spicy hot. Still tastes great. Use ground turkey for some of the meat portion. This recipe adjusts well to ingredients on hand and still taste great.
This chili has become a family favorite! sometimes we don't add the beer and it still tastes the same, but overall is an amazing dish for those looking for flavor.
This recipe is a hit every time. I make it a bit my own. Anyone who has had it loves it!!
Best chili recipe ever. We do not add the green chile peppers and we use sweet onions ( we add 2 onions).
Love this recipe. Its my standby and I leave it to simmer at least 4 hours. Absolutely killer!!!

I've made this recipe a number of times and its always been great. My bf asks me to make it at least once a month. I've always adjusted to my (our) taste. 1) Instead of beef or Italian sausage, I use bison meat- always. 2) I also use a variety of peppers besides bell pepper and chiles- I use peblano, bell, yellow chiles for color, jalapenos, and hatch. 3) Instead of regular tomatoes and paste, I always picked fire-roasted tomatoes or even Rotel, and a can of crushed tomatoes, which is more like chunky tomato sauce. 4) I use different beans. Sometimes I'll use light and dark kidney beans with chili beans. Sometimes I get "simple truth" tri-bean blend which is black, pinto and light kidney beans. Overall, I like having variety with the ingredients, but I always stick to the spices and so forth. Its great with or without beer.
My recipe to go to. My friend brought the recipe to the local hospital & won for the best chili!

Made this for Super bowl did not use peppers, cumin, or cayenne pepper. Had sooo many complements on how good this was. i browned the meat and cooked all the other ingredients on the side then added to chili once it was all blended.!

This is a GREAT recipe that my whole family loves! Close family, extended family and friends all rave about it. I‚Äôve made slight changes over the years since I‚Äôve been making it. I use petite diced tomatoes so I don‚Äôt have the larger chunks. For the chile peppers I use jalape√±os since that‚Äôs about all I can get at my local grocery store. 2 seeded jalape√±os adds great flavor. For the beer I buy the Miller High Life pony bottles which are 7-ounce bottles and are the perfect size. I also only do 3 cans of beans. I love beans but feel like 4 cans is slight over-kill. The rest of the recipe I stick to.
Absolutely delicious!
My FAVORITE and only chili I make! LOVE!
great recipe. Side note - you can easily substitute venison for the beef and it turns out perfect.
Adjusted heat because we are all a bunch of wimps!!! This is the only chili recipe I make, we absoultely LOVE it. Thank you so much for sharing!!!

I omit the celery and red/green peppers. This recipe is the best i've ever made and I continue to make it every time we have chili. I have won multiple chili cook offs using this recipe!! I do add a little more chili powder and half of a good ol Modelo!! I add it into my biggest crock pot and let it cook all day! YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM

Thought I'd try a different Chili than my own. It was just ok. Mine is better. Next time I make it, if I do I will omit the celery, and at least one if not both of the bell peppers. And perhaps the bacon bits, although the amount is so small it will probably not matter. It was good. Just not great.
Best chili I ever made. Hate to say it, mom, but your recipe is officially ditched. üòÅ
I make this chili at least once a year. I use a vegetarian ground beef (my wife is a vegetarian) and omit the meat but it's still awesome. Thank you!

Listen, I am from Texas, and I have won a ton of competitions with this spice mix. Whoever the tool from Texas was that gave this a 1 star couldn't tell his chili pot from his own rear end, just sayin. In Texas, they don't allow beans or veggies, so I cook them all down and blend them, then add the meat at the end so as not to over cook the meat. I also use a blend of smoked pulled pork, brisket and ground venison for the meat. It's a winner, I use my crawfish pot to cook enough to stock the freezer, and I add a lot more chilis for heat, however, the original spice mix was so interesting that I could not resist making a pot and experimenting. It has made all the difference.
The perfect chili! It is a little more work with all the ingredients, but worth it. Husband said it was the best chili he had ever had.

Best chili recipe I've ever found. I do use only one (fairly large) green chili pepper, I found two too hot and I can't stand celery and omit that too. Also, I am a waterfowl hunter have substituted wild Canada geese breast (ground) instead of beef. Amazing, I call it Wild Goose Chase Chili!
I doubled the spices and next time will also add more beans. But this was the best we‚Äôve ever tasted. Amazing flavor with a little kick.
I loved this recipe. I will reduce the spice next time so my wife could also enjoy the flavor of this chili.

After many years of searching for a chili recipe that hits in all the right places, this recipe became my go-to in 2018. I have lost count of how many times I have made it. I have served it at family gatherings and football parties to rave reviews. I use this recipe as written with one small exception, I reduced the ground beef to one-pound. Thank you! MIGHTYPURDUE22 Your recipe is hands-down the best I have found!
I have been making this for years. Our whole family loves this recipe!
Really good northern style chili recipe. As a native Texan I still love a bowl of ‚Äúred‚Äù but this is a nice meal on those Pennsylvania winter nights. Definitely recommend.
I made this recipe as is and it was phenomenal! I have made this numerous times, and eventually adapted my own version. HIGHLY recommend this recipe.
I've made this chili multiple times for large groups of people, and it gets rave reviews every time. Truly a great recipe!
Easy to follow recipe. Along with the hamburger, went with some andouille sausage and steak. Added Serrano and jalape√±o peppers for more kick.

I made this for the company Christmas Party and had people talking about my chili the following Monday. It's super easy to make and tastes amazing. I will be adding this to my repertoire. I did remove the cumin from the recipe because I'm not a fan of cumin.

I have made this many times and it‚Äôs my favorite chili recipe. I actually make it vegan by using Gardein crumbles and vegan Italian sausage because half of our family is vegan. Even the meat eaters love it! I usually tone down the heat for a few that can‚Äôt handle spicy and let others add hot sauce when serving.
This is the only chili I make anymore. Pinche FIRE!
Really fantastic chili. I made an account just to leave 5 stars for it. Every time I make chili, I come back to this recipe.

Hands down my favorite chili recipe! I‚Äôve made it at least a dozen time, I like to add an extra tbsp Worcestershire and a can of kidney beans to it. My family loves it, kids included. For the kids I add a tsp of sour cream on top and helps reduce the heat! Enjoy!
Have made this numerous times. Everyone always loves it. I make it with many different kinds of beans, just to mix it up.
i love this chilli . but didnt add the chilli peppers , too hot
Best chili recipe We have had..Love it !!!
This is my go-to cold weather chili recipe. Better the second day.
I've made it about a dozen times trying to follow the recipe as close as possible. Turns out perfect even though it's a pain with so many ingredients. Always a hit on the annual trip with family
Added 1 TB of cocoa powder & 2 diced carrots.

First time I ever made chili. I'm 68 y/o. Took 3d place at my Legion chili cook-off against 19 others. I tweaked the recipe just a bit. I had to use canned chili peppers. I used 1/2 of a 7 oz can. I also added about 3/4 lb extra ground beef. I like my chili meaty. Used 3 strips regular bacon (diced fine). Not hot but has a ‚Äúbite‚Äù to it. Will definitely make again, (now that my wife won't make her chili again.) Suggest you follow directions as best you can first time around, and then tweak to suit second time.

I have been using this recipe as a guide for a few years now and hands down it is the best. This time i used deer hamburger meat and i always tweak the ingredients to mine and my family's liking. Try a little Sazon with saffron while you're browning the meat. I used canned green chilis because my store didn't have fresh. Anyone that makes this will automatically love it and want to share with everyone you know. Just put your own twist on it and make it yours.
The whole family loved it!

Lots of ingredients add up to the most amazing chili. It's savory, spicy, and a tiny bit sweet. The flavor is layered and way more complex than a one note, traditional chili. There is lots of room to make it your own, too. I make this recipe every year. It makes so much that I freeze individual potions and enjoy it all winter or it could definitely feed a small army. Can say enough about this chili!

This has been my go-to chili recipe for years now. I have even won a competition or two with it. Like anyone, making chili, I wing it a bit depending on what I have on hand, but using this as a guide has never ever let me down. Best chili ever!

Love the recipe! I follow everything but cook it covered on the stovetop the first day for two hours and then smoke on charcoal the next day in a cast iron Dutch oven! I cook uncovered on the smoker with hickory or pecan wood chunks and stir every 30 minutes. The smoke is a game changer! I try to smoke for a minimum of three hours.
Came out great! Added a little ancho chili powder to heat it up a tiny bit more. Next time I make it I think I'll add in a poblano pepper

This is very good. Stayed pretty faithful to the proportions of ingredients but cut in half. Still makes a good sized batch of chili. Lots of flavor and just the right amount of heat for me. (Girlfriend thinks it's too hot.) I used Pendery's and Gebhardt's chili powders and Cholula red instead of Tabasco.

This is the very best chili recipe I have ever made! I have won several cook-offs using it. I usually end up using about a third more on the spices. I also add a package of stew meat, venison if available or any other game meat that might be on hand. if not, beef works just as good. This is a pepper based chili and becomes very flavorful. I like a bit of kick so I use Jalapeno and Serrano. If you don't like hot, then cut out the hotter peppers, but chili should have a bit of kick in my opinion.
This just in... champion of this afternoon's BRIGHT-FM Baltimore Chili Cook-Off with this recipe. Boom.
I combined My hunting camp chili with this one. Used ground venison and sausage and added mushrooms plus few minor changes. Best ever
Used crockpot and didn‚Äôt use green chilies but put chipotle instead! Love, Love,Love it!!

Step-Dad said it was the best he's every had! So many compliments from so many different people! Wouldn't do it any other way (of course there are a few "me things" thrown in, but nothings big. Love it!!!
Perfect. I used Dr Pepper as substitute for the alcohol.

I have made this chili many times with only minor modifications according to what I did or did not have on hand at the time. It is flexible and ALWAYS a hit. We are supposed to get our first snow of the winter this week, so it is chili time. BTW, I always made it at least a day ahead. It seems to be best when it has time for the flavors to meld.

I have made this recipe and have won 3 times. I also use real bacon. I use a little less cayenne pepper and Tabasco to tone down the heat. I also use white wine instead of the beer. Make it the day before so all the ingredients can blend.

I wanted a new chili recipe for a "chili cookoff" I entered so I picked this recipe. I can't believe it, but I won the contest with this recipe!! I have never won a contest like this before! I made it exactly as the recipe called for 2 days ahead of the contest. On the day of, I put it in the crockpot to heat up & I felt it was a bit thick so I added about another 1/2 cup of beer (Corona) and another TBS of chili powder & about a tsp more of cumin. I just sprinkled some shredded cheese on top & mixed it in. Oh, I did use fried bacon not bits in a jar. So excited I won! Thx for sharing your prize winning recipe!
This chili won me a marriage proposal. üòÇ
Made this for years. Everyone begs for it. But agree with others to fry bacon and I use Shiner dark beer except i use one cup of beer and 2 slices of wright maple bacon.
This recipe won me my office chili competition. I swapped the ground beef for Brisket, and it was a hit.

The BEST chili recipe. Period. I've been using this recipe for YEARS. Never fails. OUTSTANDING. I've made it with AND without the beans (depending on the crowd preference). Regardless, it's Fantastic. Highly recommend frying your own bacon (vs. buying bacon bits). Made a HUGE difference in flavor. Also - do not add cheap beer. The beer quality makes a big difference. Don't skip the beer.
Best ever!
I've been making this for years and its always a hit.
Best chili recipe that I've ever made. Family can't seem to get enough of it.
This recipe is perfect just as it is written. I have made it many times and it always gets rave reviews!
Forgot to add celery and bacon bits but it was still delicious!
My family LOVED this recipe!! I have made chili many times, but liked the ingredient list on this one and wanted to give it a try. All five adults gave it 2 thumbs up, just as it is written.
4th time I made it. Out of this World ! 6th time. !
This is our favorite Chili recipe!!

I wanted to make a half batch of this recipe and therefore reduced the amounts of meat, beans and vegetables. Fortunately, I neglected to half the amount of spices and the resulting chili was excellent. I have used this recipe several times and I have always doubled the amount of spices to great success. Everyone responds well to it.
It's our go to chili recipe. Like others, I only used 2 cans of beans. The beer I used was guiness which adds a heartiness to the flavor.
I have made several different variations of this with beef and sausage. Made at least three dozen times. Delicious.

I used to not eat chili because I didn't like beans. I made this recipe for a chili cook-off at work and won first prize without even tasting it first. Now I make this every winter and even I love it!

This has become a tradition in our house now. We've made this on Super Bowl Sunday for the last two years and it is soooooo goooood! We found out we could cook this in the Crockpot too and it still came out amazing!

This is only the second time making chili and it tasted like I am a chili pro! I substituted stew meat for the ground beef as someone else suggested and used a crock pot to cook. The only suggestion that I would do the second time around is put it in the crock pot without meat for 6-7 hours on low then add the browned meat and cook for an additional 2-3 hours. I also cut the vegetables in 1/2 inch chunks which made a great chunky chili !!!

Best chili recipe I‚Äôve ever made. Absolutely delicious and perfect as is. Turns out super thick and perfect taste. Lots of ingredients, but worth it. If you‚Äôre missing something, just substitute. As long as you stick to these ratios, you‚Äôll be happy.

Awesome base for a good chili. Most of my adaptions come in the form of meats. Not a fan of Italian sausage so I‚Äôve never made the original recipe. I use 2 pounds ground beef, 1 pound bite sized sirloin, 1 pound jimmy dean, 1 pound chorizo, and 1/2 pound bacon diced and rendered. Makes a really nice flavor profile. I adjust the spices to account for the extra meat because I‚Äôm a spicy. Thanks for the template!
Love this chili, V8 is great to thin this down when it's to thick.

I've been using this recipe for years now and it's always a hit. What's incredible is that I make it meatless by using vegetarian or plant-based beef crumbles and vegetarian or plant-based sausage crumbles. There is no difference in taste and texture. My company who are meat-eaters can't tell the difference unless I mention it. I always make it the day before Super Bowl Sunday and have it simmering for at least 4 hrs to elevate the flavor. I transfer it to a crockpot the next day in a warm setting so it stays nice and hot. It really is an awesome recipe.
No changes to recipe, it‚Äôs AMAZING I‚Äôve made it many times! Perfect for game day or take to a friend with cornbread.üëã
Best Chili I have made. I add a little Coffee and Honey for a sweet.

I made this chili and it was absolutely awesome!!! It was so easy to make especially when you buy the onion, peppers & celery already cut up!! In addition to the Chile Peppers I added a few Pablano Peppers and everyone drained the pot withinn2 hrs!!!
This is my go to chili recipe it never disappoints!!!!! Absolutely delicious üòã
The best never fails
One of the best chili‚Äôs I‚Äôve made!! Absolutely yummy with a kick!

This was fantastic!!!!! I have a gluten allergy, so I substituted Coke for the beer and gluten free soy sauce for the Worcestershire sauce. I also used mild chili beans instead of spicy. I left everything else as is. It is the best chili that I have ever had! Yum :)
This is just perfect. Everyone loves it. I serve over white rice with a small dollop of sour cream.
The best chili ever! I leave out the celery and bell peppers. Everyone raves about my chili.
so good!
Yummy yummy yum

I make this chili for the guys at work at Christmas time for the past 7 years, they ask for it! I double up my recipe. My changes are steak meat, pork sausage meat, and hamburger meat. I would love to use sausage but we are trying to eat healthier. I used 1.5 lbs of ground turkey and happy with that. I added 3 garlic cloves, a jalapeno and half of cayenne. No fritos or cheese for us, just the chili. Very good!!
Excellent recipe! I used jalape√±o cheddar brats and half the cayenne. It is very tasty and I'll be using this as my base chili recipe.

 I WON!
